taskDescription:
How much liquid, in liters, can a container with dimensions of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>40</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>cm</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
  <mn>20</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>cm</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
  <mn>120</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>cm</mtext>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">40\,{\text{cm}} \times 20\,{\text{cm}} \times 120\,{\text{cm}}</annotation></semantics></math> hold?
